name: vscode-debug-adapter-apache-camel
displayName: Debug Adapter for Apache Camel by Red Hat
description: Client for the Debug Adapter implementation for Apache Camel

redhat.telemetry.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable usage data and errors to be sent to Red Hat servers. Read our [privacy statement](https://developers.redhat.com/article/tool-data-collection).

camel.debugAdapter.JBangVersion.markdownDescription:
Apache Camel JBang CLI version used for internal VS Code JBang commands execution. Camel JBang CLI requirements can differ between versions, it is recommended to use `default` version to ensure all extension features work properly.

**Note**: This change will affect only commands provided by Debug Adapter for Apache Camel extension.

camel.debugAdapter.CamelVersion.markdownDescription:
Camel version used for internal VS Code Camel JBang CLI commands execution. Camel version can differ from `#camel.debugAdapter.JBangVersion#`. As default Camel version is used `#camel.debugAdapter.JBangVersion#`.

Custom Camel version definition is supported from minimal Camel JBang CLI version `3.20.3`.

**Note**: This change will affect only commands provided by Debug Adapter for Apache Camel extension.

camel.debugAdapter.RedHatMavenRepository.markdownDescription:
Define Red Hat Maven Repository, which is used automatically in case the `#camel.debugAdapter.CamelVersion#` uses Red Hat productized Camel version (e.g. `3.20.1.redhat-00026`).

**Note**: This change will affect only commands provided by Debug Adapter for Apache Camel extension.

camel.debugAdapter.redHatMavenRepository.markdownDescription:
The `#repos` placeholder will be added by default to use also repositories defined in global Camel JBang configuration file.

**Note**: The placeholder is available for versions `3.20.7/3.21` onwards.

camel.debugAdapter.ExtraLaunchParameter.markdownDescription:
User defined parameter to be applied at every launch. In case of spaces, the values needs to be enclosed with quotes. Default value is `["--local-kamelet-dir=."]`

**Note**: Excluding `--dev`, `--logging-level`, `--dep`, `--camel-version` and `--repos` which are already being used

For possible values see:

 camel run --help

or

jbang camel@apache/camel run --help

attach_pid.description: PID of the Camel Application To Debug.

attach_jmx_url.description: JMX URL of the Camel Application To Debug. Default is service:jmx:rmi:///jndi/rmi://localhost:1099/jmxrmi/camel

configurationSnippets.label: Camel: Attach Debugger
configurationSnippets.description: Attach Camel Debugger using default JMX connection URL. It expects that the Camel application to debug is running with JMX exposed, camel-debug available on the classpath and Camel version greater than 3.16.

configurationSnippets.label: Camel: Start Camel application and attach Camel debugger
configurationSnippets.description: Start Camel application and attach Camel debugger. It expects that a VS Code task with name 'Start Camel application' is available. This task is responsible to launch the Camel application with all requirements. To help, a completion is available in .vscode/tasks.json file.

body.name: Attach Camel Debugger after starting the Camel Application using the preLaunchTask specified

configurationSnippets.label: Camel: Attach Debugger with JMX URL
configurationSnippets.description: Attach Camel Debugger using JMX connection URL. It expects that the Camel application to debug is running with JMX exposed, camel-debug available on the classpath and Camel version greater than 3.16.

configurationSnippets.label: Camel: Attach Debugger using PID
configurationSnippets.description: Attach Camel Debugger using PID of the Camel Application to debug. It expects that the Camel application to debug is running with JMX exposed, camel-debug available on the classpath and Camel version greater than 3.16.

problemMatchers.name: camel.debug.problemMatcher
problemMatchers.label: Minimal problem matcher which allows to wait for the JMX endpoint to be ready for the Camel Debugger.

background.endsPattern: ^.*(JMX Connector thread started and|Debugger JMXConnector) listening at.*$
